algorithms.name:
Parallel B&C with Deterministic and Opportunistic Modes
Copyright (C) 2009, IBM Corporation and others. All Rights Reserved.
This code is licensed under the terms of the Eclipse Public License (EPL).

Parallel execution modes:
- Opportunistic: Threads process nodes as available (nondeterministic)
- Deterministic: Controlled node batching for reproducibility
- Parallel cuts: Multiple cut generators run concurrently

CbcSpecificThread: Low-level thread API wrapper (currently pthreads).
- Mutex locking for thread synchronization
- Condition variables for thread signaling
- Thread lifecycle management

CbcThread: Per-thread state and statistics.
- Node being processed (node_) and created child (createdNode_)
- Timing: timeInThread_, timeWaitingToStart_, timeLocked_
- Return codes: -1 available, 0 busy, 1 finished

CbcBaseModel: Coordinates multiple worker threads.
- Manages thread pool for tree exploration
- Handles deterministic vs opportunistic parallelism
- Collects statistics across threads

If CBC_THREAD not defined, provides dummy stub classes.
